roleset.name: admit
roleset.note: CONCEDE-V NOTES: Based on financial subcorpus. No VN class. (from concede.01-v)

CONCESSION-N NOTES: Based on verb entry concede.01; corresponds to Verbnet class future_having-13.3. Differs from verb entry in presence of arg2, noun sense is closer to "giving" than "admitting." (from concession.01-n)

role.descr: recipient or listener, admitted or given to

example.name: sentential thing arg1
example.text: Reviewing the company's scrape with disaster, Mr. Price conceded it had tried to do too much on its own.
example.arg: Reviewing the company's scrape with disaster
it had tried to do too much on its own

example.name: another
example.text: he conceded that with six kids, something like this was bound to happen.
example.arg: that with six kids, something like this was bound to happen

example.name: Within LVC
example.text: The Japanese retort that the first round was too early *PRO* to make concessions .

example.name: All arguments
example.text: They do not acknowledge that Walker has refused to accept their concession of increased financial costs to these working Americans.

roleset.name: acknowledge loss of a contest before it's official
roleset.note: CONCEDE-V NOTES: Roleset based on instances in CallHome. No relevant VN mapping. (from concede.02-v)

example.text: ...the man who was so quick *PRO* to concede the first time to George W. Bush when he thought he lost...

example.name: All arguments
example.text: Andy Vidak seemed ready to run again for the district about 10 minutes after he conceded the election to Costa.

example.name: concession-n
example.text: ...his concession to George W. Bush when he thought he lost was so quick.

roleset.name: to grant as right or privilege.
roleset.note: CONCEDE-V NOTES: Roleset based on VN class (member) future_having-13.3. (from concede.03-v)

example.name: All arguments
example.text: They conceded a longer vacation to all employees.

example.name: concession-n
example.text: The employees appreciated management's concession of a longer vacation.
